The privileged rich football players whose mutiny was headed up by $114.5 million man Von Miller who is paid to be a team leader will not be disrespecting the flag, screwing over their teammates, sticking it to loyal fans or letting their hatred of Trump take priority over what they are paid to do – shut up and play!

The Hill reports on the epiphany that has swept the Broncos’ locker room after Elway’s statement in the article “Entire Denver Broncos team to ‘stand together’ for anthem” :
The Denver Broncos announced Thursday that the entire team will stand for the national anthem as a matter of policy, beginning on Sunday.
In a statement released on the team’s official Twitter account, the organization said it would show unity by standing for the national anthem as a team, one day after a similar pledge was made by the New England Patriots.
“We may have different values and beliefs, but there’s one thing we all agree on: We’re a team and we stand together — no matter how divisive some comments and issues can be, nothing should ever get in the way of that,” the statement reads.
“Starting Sunday, we’ll be standing together.”
The team’s decision comes after President Trump on Friday called at a campaign rally in Alabama for NFL owners to fire players who kneel or otherwise protest during the national anthem. Nearly three dozen members of the Broncos knelt during the anthem on Sunday, according to the Denver Post.
The Broncos seem to be one of the teams whose black players may just realize that they badly overplayed their hands when they chose to go rogue last weekend. It was a move sanctioned by the incompetent and feckless NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell and players across the league decided to make their political statement that only served to make many fans hate them and take to burning jerseys and vowing to stop watching.
Ratings fell, Trump didn’t back down an inch and he also seems to have millions of Americans behind him no matter how the media spins it.
It was the players’ equivalent to cutting off one’s own nose to spite his face and reports are that a number of NFL teams will be standing this week although fans may have already decided that they have better things to do.
